alert.note: Alert for Chuckwalla Mountains; Chuckwalla Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 1:45PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Riverside County through 230 PM PDT... At 145 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Desert Center, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Desert Center. This includes the following highways... CA Interstate 10 between mile markers 104 and 119. CA Route 177 near mile marker 1. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
